Medium: Red and white marble of Villefranche
Dimensions: Overall (c, d) 19 x 10 3/4 in. (48.3 x 27.3 cm)
Description: Although acquired as a twelfth-century original from the monastery of Notre-Dame-du-Vilar (Roussillon), this fountain is probably a forgery based on Romanesque decorative forms of the Pyrenees, such as those of the Cuxa Cloister.
Provenance: Notre-Dame-du-Vilar, near Villelongue des Monts (Pyrénees-Orientales)[ Monsieur Paul Gouvert , Paris (1924–sold 1935)]
